There was one other sighting in Stratford on or around July 22nd 2013
divs: sighting detailsbefore i begin i want to make it clear that what i observed was so far away that it may have been a pulsating star, a planet etc. the weird thing is that i again witnessed it last night making me believe it may just be a star. unfortunately i can't see it except on clear nights. i know it can't be a jet, as in a 747 or larger because it doesn't move in a straight line. i really wish i had a telescope so i could see it better \ clearer. i also assume that if this was something out of the ordinary or strange, i would not have been the only person to see it. if it was something worth anyone's time i am sure nasa would have had one of its may telescope's pointed at it but you never know. i am a 43 year old male. i live in stratford, connecticut at 255 kenyon street. my coordinates are latitude 41.21484535145122 and longitude is -73.15099865198135. on the night of july 22nd i was out in front of my house standing in my driveway having a cigar looking up at the stars. it was a very clear night. at some point my eye caught something moving. it definitely had a shape to it which seemed to change as if it was turning or flipping end over end. i have never witnessed anything like this and it was so far away i thought it was just a star playing tricks with my mind. i watched it for a little while longer then dismissed it and went inside. about 15 days later on aug 6th i went onto my back deck and sat down in a chair and looked up at the sky again. it was another beautiful clear night. after about 15 - 20 minutes i saw what i thought was probably an airplane. what made me suspicious was that again, it was so high in the atmosphere that i thought to myself "this can't be a plane." it was a single point of light that slowly moved across the sky. there were no blinking lights, no colored lights. just one solid pinpoint of light that moved across the sky. i then thought that maybe it was the i.s.s. but i did not do the research to see where the i.s.s. was at that point and time. i dismissed it as a "shooting star" or asteroid because it moved so slow and in a perfectly straight line. i am not a ufo hunter. its just that these two circumstances happening so close together seemed very "weird", especially the first sighting. there was so much more of a "form" to it. the second sighting was just too far away to make any distinction about it even though it was moving. i know at night the sky can play tricks with your mind so i didn't want to make a big deal about it. i was curious to see if anyone else in the tri state area saw anything in the sky on those nights or nights around then. i could have kicked myself in the butt for not having a telescope those two nights. it probably could have answered a lot of questions. i think i am going to invest in a telescope so next time, if there is a next time, i will have a better idea as to what the objects may be. thank you, paul depietro
